-- About the author --

Genrikh Moiseyevich Kasparian (1910-1995) is considered one of the greatest composers of chess endgame studies. As a player, Kasparian won the Armenian championship ten times (including two ties with future World Champion Tigran Petrosian), and the Tiflis championship three times. He reached the USSR Championship finals on four occasions.

Kasparian is best known for his compositions. He started with chess problems, mainly three-movers, but soon discovered that his best field was in endgame studies. He wrote and composed several books and collections, and composed about 600 studies, winning 57 first prizes. He won the USSR Composing Championship several times.
